New Records: Pakistan recorded the highest run chase at this venue with a 7-wicket win over Canada.
Mohammad Rizwan completed his 50 in a hard-earned and effective manner.
Mohammad Amir was the Player of the Match for his impressive performance.
Key Match Events: Pakistan beat Canada by 7 wickets to finally get crucial points on the board.
Fakhar Zaman was run out for 3 runs, and Usman Khan hit the winning runs.
Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam stitched together a vital stand after a sluggish Powerplay.
Aaron Johnson played some delightful shots and powered the ball over the fence multiple times to notch up a fifty and propel Canada over 100 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and opted to bowl first, with Babar Azam saying they wanted to make the best use of the fresh pitch.
The Pakistan skipper, Babar Azam credits the boys for a good win and says they bowled well in the Powerplay.
Saad Bin Zafar, the captain of Canada says that the result is a bit disappointing and they wanted to play a positive brand of cricket but it was a difficult wicket to bat early on.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Amir says he is really pleased with the performance and says as a bowler you need to adapt according to the conditions and got the success.
Babar Azam says that the NRR was in their mind and they aimed to finish it before 14 overs but the pitch made it a bit difficult as it was a two-paced wicket.
Saad Bin Zafar says that facing high-quality sides is a learning curve for them and applauds Aaron Johnson for his innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Presentation ceremony took place after the match.
Canada are now in the same boat as Pakistan with just one win from 3 and with a game left to play.
Both teams will now have their eyes on the India vs USA clash as that could decide the fate of this group.
Others: The T20 World Cup 2024 22nd T20I PAK vs CAN fixture will be played at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium, New York.
You can watch Pakistan vs Canada T20 World Cup 2024 22nd T20I on Disney+ Hotstar in Pakistan and on the Star Sports network.
